result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R Glass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant will not request early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No medication without a valid prescription. No contact with co-defendant while out of custody.

timeConds.notes:
Consecutive to 21CF459; With work release privileges.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R Glass

defendant.name: Glass, Joshua R
defendant.address: N1776 N Daisy Dr., Genoa City, WI 53128

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition to Revoke Huber

Defendant Joshua R Glass appeared in court, Attorney Keith Kolby Venema appeared in court for Joshua R Glass, Attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:20 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing on both files - 21CF459 and 22CF16. Record by Atty. Venema as to the agreement of the parties. Court goes over maximum penalties, elements, and deportation warnings. Attorney Venema responds to questions of the Court regarding entry of plea and stipulates to facts in the criminal complaint. 
Defendant pleads GUILTY to counts #1 & #2 in file 21CF459 - Counts #3 & #4 are dismissed and read-in.
Defendant pleads GUILTY to count #1 in file 22CF16 - Counts #2 & #3 are dismissed and read-in.
Court finds pleas to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent; and finds defendant guilty.
Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Court adopts the agreement of the parties as to sentence - **SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT**
Court in recess.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua R Glass in court with attorney Keith Kolby Venema.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:35 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on file 22CF16 and status on 21CF459. Record by Atty. Venema as to 22CF16 - Defendant is prepared to waive his preliminary hearing. Atty. Venema provides waiver form to the Court who goes over it with the defendant. Defendant responds to questions of the Court as to waiver and finds that waiver is made knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently. Record by the State that the information is not ready, but will be the same as the charges in the criminal complaint. Response by Atty. Venema that based on State's assertion he will enter not guilty plea as to all counts on behalf of his client. Further record by Atty. Venema who would like a short turn around for resolution as to both files. Court grants the request.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Not guilty by Attorney Venema on behalf of his client as to all charges.

Attorney Keith Kolby Venema appeared.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant refused access to building due to exposure. Minutes filed.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Joshua R Glass in court in custody via video with attorney Keith Venema.  Samuel Berg for State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond by atty Venema denied, bond remains.  Atty Venema has not seen notice of arrest or risk assessment.  Minutes filed.

DEFENDANT TO POST $1,000 CASH.
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
